page.title: 05Rhenigidale School.
page.content: My name is Fiona Mackay. I am 10 years old and I go to school at Rhenigidale Primary School in Rhenigidale. I am the only pupil in the whole school! There is only one teacher here as well, my aunt, Mrs Moira Mackay. The school building is divided into two rooms with a classroom and another room for the library/church. The classroom is a normal school with a blackboard, cupboards, books, tables and chairs etc. even a computer! About 70 years ago there would have been about 25 pupils as the population was then about 100. I have a 14 year old sister Marianne but she goes to the Sir E. Scott School in Tarbert. She has to stay in lodgings during the week but she comes home at weekends. My parents walk over and collect her after school on Fridays and they take her back over on Sundays.
